name: Vuforia
description: Vuforia is an engine supported in Unity. Vuforia is its own AR tech that runs in both iOS and Android and can run on older phones. Vuforia will use ARKit/ARCore tech if the hardware will support it. Vuforia also has other advanced features like image tracking, motion planning.
price: Free to use, paid to publish
use_cases: Claims to be the most sophisticated and advanced AR content development solution
curstomer_segment: Largest segment is to help industrial enterprise customers address workforce challenges and meet business goals.
limitations: Vuforia is an old well-developed and great product. That supports the widest range of products.  There are no significant limitations of Vuforia when compare to ARCore and ARKitFor both apple and android. Costs money to publish application.

name: OpenCV
description: OpenCV (Open source computer vision) is a library of programming functions mainly aimed at real-time computer vision.

name: Unity3D
description: Key features: Great for cross platform development, Language required: C# or JavaScript, One of the few great VR/AR real-time development tools, Asset store, Great documentation, Different rendering pipelines for different hardwares specs (HighDefinitionRenderingPipeline for AAA games and Universal Rendering Pipeline for mobile), Friendly with many great softwares related to 3D real time development
key_features: one of the few great VR/AR real-time development tools
Different rendering pipelines for different hardwares specs (HighDefinitionRenderingPipeline for AAA games and Universal Rendering Pipeline for mobile)
friendly with many great softwares related to 3D real time development
limitations:
Graphics, 
Does not allow you to load your work from a template or foundation, Licensing is annoying,
Language: C#
notes: Unity has great resources for developers to dive in. The company has many new feature presentations, tutorials, documentation on codes and on collaboration with leading companies in real time industries.

name: Wikitude SDK
price: Free trial; one-time fee: demo (499 euro), SDK Startup (499 euro), SDK Pro 3D (2490 euro); subscription: 2990+ euro
notes:
Once developed web AR called “AR Window” in 2012.
Didn’t find anything about web AR development since then.

name: Spark AR
limitations: Limited hand tracking, submission requires review process, only works on Facebook and Instagram apps.

name: ManoMotion
description: ManoMotion provides a framework for real- time 3D gestural analysis. Minimal hardware, minimal computing power. All that is required is a simple RGB camera found in everyday smartphone.

name: Unreal Engine
description:
Key features:Technical art pipeline, world building, animation, simulation, optimization
One of the few great VR/AR real-time development tools
Offers one of the best graphics in real time development
Artist friendly software (no coding required)
Language supported: C++, Blueprints(visual programming)
key_features: optimization One of the few great VR/AR real-time development tools Offers one of the best graphics in real time development
price:
Free for hobby development.
5% royalty fee after the first 3000 dollars earned for professionals.
limitations: No support of Vuforia, less convenient for 2D
notes: Not good for solo devs apparently

name: ARKit
description: Framework from Apple for building AR apps and games for iOS devices. High level API supplying powerful features for creating virtual objects. Utilizes SLAM to accurately map the surroundings.
price: Free to use, paid to publish
popularity: Most used framework for iOS AR applications
limitations: Apple: Tracking is an inexact science. It relies on details of the physical environment that aren’t always consistent or are difficult to measure in real time without some degree of error. https://developer.apple.com/documentation/arkit/understanding_world_tracking, Apple devices iPhone SE, iPhone 6s and later, iPad 2017 and later, all iPad Pro models

name: ARCore
description: Google platform for building AR experiences, using different APIs ARCore enables your phone to sense its environment, understand the world and interact with information.
use_cases: AR app building platform for Android devices.
limitations: Supported devices: Google Pixel, Pixel XL, Pixel 2, Pixel 2 XL, Samsung Galaxy S8

name: AR.js
description: AR. js is a lightweight library for Augmented Reality on the Web, coming with features like Marker based and Location based AR.

name: 8th Wall
description: 8th Wall enables developers to create, collaborate and publish Web AR experiences that run directly in a mobile web browser.
popularity: Startups but very profession in web AR.

name: Three.js
description: Three.js is a cross-browser JavaScript library and Application Programming Interface (API) used to create and display animated 3D computer graphics in a web browser.
related_hardwares: an iPhone with a WebXR browser
limitations: AR technology special for Three.js has not been released. AR capability relays on the 8th wall. Low level development tool in VR section. Syntax / commands keep changing
notes:
Using threex.artookit (the extension of Three.js) which is part of AR.js. 
Develop AR relays on AR.js which is a higher level library built on Three.js.

name: A-Frame
description: A-Frame is a three.js framework with an entity-component-system (ECS) architecture.
key_features: A-Frame is a three.js framework with an entity-component-system (ECS) architecture.
related_hardwares: For browsers that support ARCore and ARKit
notes:
Can experiment AR on ARCore compatible devices and Chrome 79 or newer.
Mature AR development with AR.js https://github.com/jeromeetienne/ar.js
Works with 8th Wall easily. 
Well developed, just like an online Unity. Also, good  Being based on top of HTML, A-Frame is accessible to everyone.

name: Amazon Sumerian
description: Augmented reality experiences built with Amazon Sumerian run on Android and iOS mobile devices without requiring native app downloads (based on WebGL 2.).
price: Charged for the total size of the 3D assets upload and store in Sumerian at the rate of $0.06 per GB per month. Free Tier, you can get started with Amazon Sumerian for free. Upon sign-up, new customers can create up to a 50MB published scene that receives the equivalence of 100 views (5GB) per month, for the first 12 months.
related_hardwares: Mobile browsers: iOS: Safari (iOS 11 or newer)
Desktop browsers: Firefox 61 or newer/ Chrome 69 or newer
VR headsets: HTC Vive/ Vive Pro/ Oculus Rift/ Oculus Rift S/ Oculus Go/ Oculus Quest/ Samsung Gear VR
popularity: A competition using it with 1276 participants.
limitations: Not sure whether has an independent Web AR capability without 8th Wall
notes: Work with 8th wall. Can also develop native apps. They did image tracking with 8th wall on web. Provide a library of primitive shapes, 3D models, hosts, textures, and scripts.

name: Babylon.js
description: Babylon.js is a real time 3D engine using a JavaScript library for displaying 3D graphics in a web browser via HTML5.
limitations: Didn’t find many applications or use-case for AR development. May be not popular as A-Frame and PlayCanvas in AR development.
notes: BabylonAR is a plugin intended to bring AR and computer vision functionality to Babylon.js Web apps. Also work with 8th Wall.

name: PlayCanvas
description: PlayCanvas is an open-source[1] 3D game engine/interactive 3D application engine alongside a proprietary cloud-hosted creation platform that allows for simultaneous editing from multiple computers \via a browser-based interface
related_hardwares: modern devices with browsers that support WebGL
limitations: Have not updated the AR tools since 2017.  Maybe not mature/professional as the A-Frame in the AR section.
notes: It has a mature web AR development tool using AR Starter Kit. Works with 8th Wall

name: Lens Studio
key_features: ability for users to make their own custom filters
limitations: lenses are only created for use on Snapchat
